definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
ancient bronze wine holder with 3 legs and loop handle/nobility
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: Lord Henry turned and looked at the duchess with his slumberous eyes .
sentences.chinese: 亨利勳爵轉過頭來，用倦怠的眼睛望着公爵夫人。

sentences.english: The Dowager Duchess of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha continued to reside in Coburg.
sentences.chinese: 在薩克森公爵夫人太后科堡與哥達繼續居住在科堡。

sentences.english: Duchesses , the most delicate and charming women in the world.
sentences.chinese: 公爵夫人們，世界上最雅緻最可愛的婦女。

sentences.english: The full skirt was framed by a band of silk duchess satin and a subtle train.
sentences.chinese: 傘裙由一圈絲質公爵夫人緞和一小段裙裾組成。

sentences.english: The old princess rose respectfully and curtsied at his entrance.
sentences.chinese: 老公爵夫人恭敬地起身行屈膝禮。

sentences.english: Alice: So did the Duchess of Cambridge.
Clearly Eliza will not pass as a duchess.
sentences.chinese: 很明顯，伊莉莎現在還不能被當作公爵夫人。

sentences.english: The next witness was the Duchess's cook.
sentences.chinese: 下一個作證人是公爵夫人的廚師。

sentences.english: Duke and Duchess were finally united under British soil.
sentences.chinese: 公爵和公爵夫人終於在英國的土壤下重逢了。

sentences.english: She was known in her family as ‘the Duchess’.
sentences.chinese: 她在家族裏的尊稱是“公爵夫人”。

sentences.english: Yes, duchesses have awkward moments too.
sentences.chinese: 是的，公爵夫人也會有尷尬的時候。

sentences.english: I worked as a companion to an old princess.
sentences.chinese: 我當過一位老公爵夫人的陪伴人。

sentences.english: "My Last Duchess" is a famous dramatic monologue by Browning.
sentences.chinese: 《我最後的公爵夫人》是勃郎寧的著名戲劇獨白。

definition: Hailun county level city in Suihua 綏化|绥化, Heilongjiang/Helen or Hélène (name)
